intro: Cybianthus costaricanus subsp. acuminatus, commonly known as the Acuminated Cybianthus, is a flowering plant native to Costa Rica. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
